name: Radisson Blu Daugava Hotel, Riga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take a business class room and you will really enjoy it! Great views of Old Riga with its churches and the rest of the stuff from the balcony - rooms are located on the top floors. Breakfast is reach and enjoyable like in not many other hotels both in Riga and worldwide. Staff is very helpfull and does all the best to make you enjoy your stay at Radisson Daugava. Old Riga is located less than 5 minutes walk over the bridge. Some people say the property needs some interior renovation... well, they are right, but despite of this you will enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: Just over the bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is great. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and well furnished / decorated. The staff is helpful and low profile. I would recommend Radisson Blu Daugava to anyone who like quality and best experience. Also I wish to recommend Alibi restaurant where we tasted fantastic Latvian Traditional Grill. Thank to owners Dace&Raivis. Fantastic couple. They told us which sightseeing are the best in the town and they was 100% right. We’ve got maximum pleasure from visiting Riga.
reviews.title: Great service and comfort

reviews.text: The hotel, and Riga in general, is full of ONLY Russians.
reviews.title: Russian Riga

reviews.text: We spent New Year's Eve in Riga, staying at the Radisson Blu Daugava hotel. The hotel is not bad. But the place is full of Russians and we seemed like the only non-Russians there. Even the staff greet you in Russian until they realise that you're not actually Russian.
reviews.title: Great service, close to city center.

reviews.text: Service at the hotel varied from day to day, good to bad!
reviews.title: Nice Business Hotel

reviews.text: The person who called Riga "Not so riveting" must have been walking around with her/his eyes shut. What a beautiful place this is. My partner and I have been to a few Eastern European cities (Prague, Budapest, Tallin, Warsaw) and this was our favourite by some way. Ok, so the hotel (whilst clean and totally pleasant) is never going to win any wards for the best 5* in the world you cannot expect the same standard as you would in a 5*, say, in the UK. The breakfasts were great and the staff extremely friendly. Our visit was made all the more special due to the covering of snow and the many Xmas tress that were still up in January. Add to this many great bars at more than reasonable prices and restaurants with great quality food and you have all the ingredients for a really fabulous weekend!
reviews.title: When can we go back?
Can it get any better?
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet, indoor heated swimming pool, and one of the best casinos in town - can it get any better? Of course. The sad thing is, I could have spent all my time in Riga at the Radisson hotel.

reviews.title: fantastic
reviews.text: Prior to our arrival we ensured we would receive a higher level room (7th floor) over looking Old Town Riga and the staff were extremely accomodating. Admitedly it isn't an extremely beautiful view, but looking at the lights of Old Town through our window at night was refreshing.

The breakfast buffet still has my mouth watering. I haven't seen a European buffet with so much food - eggs to order, pancakes, beans, salad, asian dishes, meats, cheeses, breads, fruit, vegetables ... I could continue itemizing, but I'm getting hungry.
reviews.title: Not so rivetting Riga
Nice hotel...subdued staff and locals
reviews.text: The casino was a bit on the small side, but had something for every gambler: roulette, blackjack, 5 and 3 card poker, and some of the most current slot machines. The only thing I didn't like about the slot machines was when you wanted to cash out. Depending upon the payout you would either get tokens (definetly need to upgrade to electronic cards) or would have to wait for an attendant to pay out. On the up side, though, drinks were free (not mixed drinks).

We were staying in this hotel at the end of a long Baltic trip. We chose the hotel for it being close to the airport and giving us international comfort. We were not disappointed. While of course this hotel was much more expensive than other Baltic hotels, the room was very comfortable (a bedroom and a separate sitting room). usual international amenities, nice bathroom with bath, free wireless internet. The hotel is on the other side of the Daugava river from the old city. A fairly long bridge separates the two sides of the river. We ate dinner in the hotel ("internationa " cuisine, not latvian at all, and international prices.
reviews.title: Nice as expected

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for one night in May had another night booked afterwards the same week, but needed to cancel. I ha no access to the internet at the time so I phoned to cancel way before the policy time of 6.00pm (Iphoned at 4.00pm!) However upon my return home I find my card had been charged for one nights stay £140!!!!
reviews.title: Worst customer service ever...

reviews.text: I tried to phone reservation ut they conveniently lost my cancellation confirmation somewhere in the office, no-one has had the deceny to phone me back and advise me of the situation and I am still trying to get my money back...
reviews.title: A bit dated and on wrong side of the water. Stay in the other Radisson in Riga.
Nice view, decent hotel
reviews.text: AVOID THIS HOTEL IT IS DATED AND THE STAFF ARE TERRIBLE AT RESOLVING ANY ISSUES AND BLAME OTHER EMPLOYEES

Could do with a facelift. Friendly staff. Room decor and furniture looks ten years old, at least! Don't think I would stay again. Menu in restaurant basic and delivery of food below what you would expect for a radisson.
reviews.title: World Selects 98 Invitational Teams Host Hotel

reviews.text: Very dated rooms. Old small crt tv, poor selection of english speaking channels, noisy ac, not very cold minibar. Room with "garden view" means looking at ugly brick houses and listening to construction work. Long walk over bridge to old town with lots no traffic. Casino inhouse seemed to be closed, staff did not know however. No safe in room. Staff tried to sell breakfast although i already had paid for it.
reviews.title: An average experience

reviews.text: + ok standard breakfast selection. Clean rooms. Inhouse spa and small pool. Atm in reception.
reviews.title: A good hotel with a beautiful location!

reviews.text: Conclusion: not a five star by western european standards, but decent enough for price.
reviews.title: Decent, but not good for business trips

reviews.text: The Radisson BLU Daugava in Riga is one of these large hotels which does not give you a very intimate feeling. The rooms I had, were both good, even though the bathrooms are beginning to look oldfashioned.
reviews.title: Lovely views from observation deck, but a little dated

reviews.text: The location is beautiful with stunning views of the old Hanseatic city centre, located directly across the river Daugava.
reviews.title: Two and half weeks in Riga.

reviews.text: Whatever people might say about Global Hotel Chains, I like it when I kno exactly what I get wheWhatever people might say about Global Hotel Chains, I like it if I know exactly what I get when I book a room in one of the many 'Chain-Hotels'. This is especially re-assuring after touring the Latvian countryside, never knowing what you are going get at the venues you booked in advance. Even though we where not disappointed many times (please read my other reviews of Latvian Hotels).
reviews.title: Its a Radisson and I love it

reviews.text: We checked in to the Radisson for our second last night in Latvia, took a shower and then ‘hit’ the town once more. Check-In was swift and genuinely friendly (at least at Latvian standards). The room had everything you might expect in a 5-star Hotel. What I like the most about the big chains (Radisson, Sheraton, Marriott, Hilton, etc) are the huge and immensely comfortable King or Queen size beds (King in this case)
reviews.title: very good hotel with good view

likes.liked: — quiet, service, placement of the hotel, view, quality

reviews.text: The Old Town is just a short stroll across the bridge. After sprinting back to the hotel across the bridge in poring rain and a cup of tea we hit the huge beds and slept like babies!
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in Riga.

reviews.text: We only stayed one night so we didn’t get to try all the amenities the Hotel has to offer. Breakfast Buffet was excellent, the only complaint might haven been the Arctic temperatures in the restaurant and the fact that you had to clear the dirty dishes of the table yourself if wished to be seated anytime soon.
reviews.title: not a 5* hotel

reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Save money - stay somewhere else

reviews.text: Great hotel but on the wrong side of the river! The hotel provides a minibus shuttle to the old town on the hour and it is only a fifteen minute walk from the hotel to the old town. On one occasion the bus was full and we were given a free taxi to the old town, this is what i call good service. The hotel itself is a modern , spacious hotel and the breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: Fab Raddision

reviews.text: There is a supermarket on the end of the block that is recommended for stocking up with drinks and snacks etc:.Attached to the supermarket is a cafe which sell snack meals which cost less than 2LATS each including a drink!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Riga is a beatiful City, as are the people. Don't go to the museum though unless you are prepared for the worst. The history of Latvia until recently has indeed been tragic with invasions by the Germans then the Russians, then the Germans.........
reviews.title: Good in Parts
Great food, shame about the rooms
reviews.text: The market is an amazing site how can good food be prouced so cheaply?

This is a great hotel and a good location for a stag do - which is why I was there. On arrival we were initially given small hot rooms - think sauna with beds 2 of the party immediately complained and got an upgrade to a suit overlooking the river - no extra charge - its always worth complaining - nicely.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is the second time I've been here for business.
reviews.title: Classy hotel, good for business

reviews.text: The hotel has spacious rooms with good beds. The rooms overlooking the Daugava and the old city offer a great view.
reviews.title: I stayed there several weeks.....

reviews.text: Breakfast offers varied buffet with early opening (6.30 am). Restaurant serves delicious meals, but the waiting time can be quite long.
reviews.title: Better than expected from reviews

reviews.text: There is free use of fitness including also a swimming pool and sauna.
reviews.title: Average, do not expect so much.

reviews.text: I missed a safe in my room.
reviews.title: Need deffinately some liftup

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a visit to Riga, staying in the Radisson from 4-7 May 2007. I must honestly say, I don't think I have ever stayed in such a bad hotel. Our flight was delayed and we arrive Saturday morning at 1am. The staff were highly unfriendly, did not even welcome us and just handed us our room keys, not even telling us what floor we were on, or how to get there.
reviews.title: do not stay here

likes.liked: — The view of the Old Town

reviews.title: Only Business Class rooms are worth thinking about
reviews.text: Our room was clean but highly outdated, with the bathroom looking like something from a time warp. The bedroom window would not close properly, becoming loose after a few hours, so you get woken up with the noisy traffic outside later in the night.
Breakfast was included in our price, but was cold at the buffet in the panorama restaurant and was no better with room service - a big disappointment on your wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Not as great as I expected

reviews.text: The free shuttle bus to the airport and old town is great, but overall I have to say that the staff were unquestionably the biggest let down. When you are a paying customer you at least expect to get a hello or good morning, but it was more a grunt than anything else.
reviews.title: No way 5 star!

reviews.text: No way near a 3-star, I would recommend booking somewhere else in the old town.
reviews.title: Average stay

aka: Radisson Blu Daugava Hotel, Riga Hotel Riga
description: Hotel is conveniently located on the bank of the Daugava River with a breathtaking view of Riga's Old Town. Hotel offers 361 fully equipped rooms, including Business Class, Suites and Presidential Apartment as well as non smoking rooms and rooms for disabled. All rooms are equipped with bathtub, TV, telephone, mini-bar, air-conditioning and have 24-hours room service. Free broadband is available for all hotels residential guests and anywhere in the hotel. Hotel also offers a free shuttle bus service to the city center.
